title: Inter Milan captain Mauro Icardi slapped with two-game ban for kicking ball at referee in fiery clash with Juventus - Mirror Online
text:
Mauro Icardi and his teammates argue with referee Nicola Rizzoli (Photo: AFP) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Mauro Icardi has been handed a two-game ban for petulantly kicking the ball at the referee during Inter Milan's 1-0 defeat to Juventus. 
The Argentinian striker, along with his teammates, went into meltdown in the ill-tempered affair which was decided by Juan Cuadrado's long-range strike. 
At the full-time whistle in the Derby d'Italia, Icardi lost his head, kicking the ball at the official Nicola Rizzoli. 
The news is a double blow for manager Stefano Pioli, with Ivan Perisic also banned for two games after a red card for dissent. Icardi reacts in frustration after his side's 1-0 loss to Juventus (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Juan Cuadrado's thunderbolt settled the contest at the Juventus Stadium (Photo: AFP) Inter will now lose their captain for two games (Photo: AFP) Read More 
The pair will now miss Serie A games against Empoli and Bologna in a blow to the Nerazzurri's hopes of finishing in the top three for Champions League qualification. 
The incident involving Icardi was caught on camera, with Rizzoli seen asking, 'who kicked the ball?'
